nodes.text: Eroudac was a terrestrial planet located in the Mid Rim and the Slice regions. The planet was orbited by at least one pink moon. After 21 ABY, the Garsea family settled on the planet and established themselves in the Eroudac Citadel. Sometime after her parents died, the smuggler Izal Garsea left the planet after failing a smuggling job for one of her professors at the academy.

Eroudac was a small terrestrial planet with a breathable atmosphere located in the Mid Rim and the Slice regions of the galaxy. The planet was orbited by at least one pink-colored moon. The smuggler Izal Garsea considered the planet a small world.

In  21 ABY, the Garsea family moved out from the Outer Rim planet of Batuu and eventually arrived at the Mid Rim planet of Eroudac, where they settled at the Eroudac Citadel. After settling on the planet, Izal Garsea started to attend a local academy to appease her father. Garsea spent most of her days on Eroudac at the spaceport, where she would board her family's light freighter, the Meridian, and fly it around the planet. The planet had a local law enforcement agency capable of issuing citations and granting landing permits. Izal's mother, Ixel Garsea, had been able to smooth-talk her way out of citations and get landing permits from Eroudac's police officers.

Following the death of her parents, Izal Garsea took a Galactic Politics course at the academy on Eroudac. During the course, she met a fellow student and started dating him. The relationship ended after she met her boyfriend's parents, who did not care for an orphaned woman like Garsea, who had no social status on Eroudac and no aspirations of becoming a politician's wife. Sometime later, Garsea accepted a smuggling job from the academy's genetic science professor. She was set to travel to the planet Haneli aboard her starship, acquire some haneli flowers, and smuggle them off of the planet. During the job, Garsea was caught with the flowers, and decided to drop the cargo and to abandon her home on Eroudac rather than returning to face her professor.

In 34 ABY, Izal Garsea returned to the planet Batuu, where she reunited with her old childhood friend, Julen Rakab. When she was explaining to Rakab where she had been, Garsea told Rakab everything that had happened at Eroudac. After a skirmish at Kat Saka's farm, Garsea learned that Rakab owned a starship, which motivated her to invite Rakab on a date on Eroudac.

Rakab was initially confused about the choice of Eroudac, but Garsea explained that Eroudac was the last place where she had lived with her parents, and that it had ancient ruins and a pink moon. Rakab agreed to go on the date once his ship got repaired. Rakab and Garsea started dating, but their plan to go to Eroudac did not came to fruition, and they instead hoped to visit it together one day. The historian Eloc Throno included Eroudac on a map in his book Traveler's Guide to Batuu.

The Eroudac Citadel was a residence where the Garsea family lived during their stay on Eroudac until Izal Garsea decided to leave the planet. Other points of interest on Eroudac included the local spaceport, an academy, and ancient ruins.
Eroudac was first mentioned in the 2019 novel A Crash of Fate, written by Zoraida Córdova. Eroudac is an anagram for Ecuador, the country where Córdova was born.
